page.title: 16The Motorway.
page.content: The stetch of the M1 dominates the area. It is situated less than 60 metres from Blackburn School,making it possibly the closest to a motorway in England.A survey was taken in June 1985 by a group of children.They studied traffic on both North and South bound lanes from a footbridge close to the school.In a five minute period from 11.35a.m. to 11.40a.m.,122 vehicles were heading North,129 were heading South.Almost 2 out of 5 vehicles were lorries or vans.One vehicle passed the onlooker almost every second.This was also not one of the busiest times. When the motorway was built in our area in 1968,one local road had to be demolished to make way for it. A huge embankment several metres high has been built to take the motorway above the Blackburn Valley.
